cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 mi ENE of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Nicole is forecast to move west-southwest toward the north-western Bahamas on Tuesday, then continue westward to make landfall along Florida’s east-central coast Wednesday night before turning northwestward across the Florida Peninsula toward southern Georgia.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central coast of Florida (around the Treasure Coast to Volusia/Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Hallandale Beach FL northward to the Volusia/Brevard County Line; Storm Surge Watch North Palm Beach to Hallandale Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Hallandale Beach FL northward to Altamaha Sound GA including Lake Okeechobee; Storm Surge Warning North Palm Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA including the St. Johns River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: NW Bahamas, entire east coast of Florida, interior Florida Peninsula (including west-central coast near Tampa Bay), and southeastern U.S. coastline northward into Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph with higher gusts) are possible at Port Manatee late Wednesday night through Thursday as Nicole’s center passes just east-northeast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge guidance issued for the west-central Gulf coast at this time; primary surge threat is along Florida’s Atlantic side.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally higher amounts could fall across west-central Florida, producing periods of heavy rainfall and localized flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and rough seas spreading into Tampa Bay could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations; isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out over the peninsula.
